<FI>A Psalm<Fi> of David. Unto thee will I cry, O LORD my rock; be not silent to me: lest, <FI>if<Fi> thou be silent to me, I become like them that go down into the pit.<RF>to me: Heb. from me<Rf>
Hear the voice of my supplications, when I cry unto thee, when I lift up my hands toward thy holy oracle.<RF>thy…: or, the oracle of thy sanctuary<Rf>
Draw me not away with the wicked, and with the workers of iniquity, which speak peace to their neighbours, but mischief <FI>is<Fi> in their hearts.
Give them according to their deeds, and according to the wickedness of their endeavours: give them after the work of their hands; render to them their desert.
Because they regard not the works of the LORD, nor the operation of his hands, he shall destroy them, and not build them up.<CM>
Blessed <FI>be<Fi> the LORD, because he hath heard the voice of my supplications.
The LORD <FI>is<Fi> my strength and my shield; my heart trusted in him, and I am helped: therefore my heart greatly rejoiceth; and with my song will I praise him.
The LORD <FI>is<Fi> their strength, and he <FI>is<Fi> the saving strength of his anointed.<RF>their: or, his<Rf><RF>saving…: Heb. strength of salvations<Rf>
Save thy people, and bless thine inheritance: feed them also, and lift them up for ever.<RF>feed: or, rule<Rf><CM>
